concept_data.title: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
concept_data.preferred_term: UN Framework Convention on Climate Change

summary: The "UN Framework Convention on Climate Change" (UNFCCC) is a pivotal international treaty aimed at addressing climate change through cooperative efforts among nations. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, the UNFCCC serves as a foundational instrument guiding environmental policy. The EU actively participates in the UNFCCC, aligning its climate strategies with its obligations under this convention. This relationship underscores the EU's commitment to global climate governance and its regulatory measures aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions. As a redirect, this concept emphasizes the significance of the preferred term "UN Framework Convention on Climate Change" in EU environmental discourse.
